text: sources of air pollutants are?

options.A: industrial chimneys, burning fossil oils and river dams
options.C: sulphur dioxide, vehicle exhausts, and aerosols

explanation:
Household combustion devices, motor vehicles, industrial facilities and forest fires are common sources of air pollution. Pollutants of major public health concern include particulate matter, carbon monoxide, ozone, nitrogen dioxide and sulfur dioxide.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: The body of a snail is divided into head?
explanation:
A snail's body consists of these main parts – the head, the visceral hump, and the foot
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: An adaptation for defense in animals is?
explanation:
The porcupine fish has spines on its body. The fish sucks in water and swells up to make the spines stick out. This transforms it from a small mouthful into an uneatable ball of prickly spines. Its flesh also contains a deadly poison as an extra defense.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: The movement of Euglena towards the source of light is a?
explanation:
taxis (tactic movement) A change in direction of locomotion in a motile micro-organism or cell, made in response to certain types of external stimulus
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: During mitosis, the stage at which chromosomes lines up around the equator is?
explanation:
Mitosis is understood to involve five phases, based on the physical state of the chromosomes and spindle. These phases are prophase, prometaphase, metaphase, anaphase, and telophase.
Metaphase is the third phase of mitosis, which is a process that separates the duplicated genetic material carried in the nucleus of a parent cell into two, identical daughter cells
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: The waste product of insects is?
explanation:
Most terrestrial insects produce uric acid as their main nitrogenous waste product. Uric acid is a relatively non- toxic and highly insoluble waste product.
Therefore, it can crystallize out of solution, and may be either retained in the body, or eliminated as a solid waste material with little water loss.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: Succession that occurs on an abandoned farm land is?
explanation:
Succession can be defined as a progressive natural development of vegetation towards a climax during which one community is gradually replaced by others. The abandoned farmland is asecondary successionas a result of the fact that it follows a partial destruction of the original vegetation.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: In Nigeria, Southern Guinea Savanna is found in?
explanation:
Southern Guinea Savanna occurs in parts ofOyo, Ondo, Osun and Kwarastates.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: Which of the following is associated with the dark stage of photosynthesis?
explanation:
Dark stage, also known as biosynthetic or assimilatory, is the second stage in photosynthesis;
in this stage, a cluster of reactions; solar light is not needed and converts carbon dioxide – among other complexes  into sugars.
some enzymes are involved in carbon assimilation process depend on solar light.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: The part of mammalian skin that excretes metabolic wastes is?
explanation:
Sweat glands are used to regulate temperature and remove waste by secreting water, sodium salts, and nitrogenous waste (such as urea) onto the skin surface.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: The feeding relationship that exists between a tick and a cow is?
explanation:
Cows are not immune to ticks and thanks to their hairy hides, ticks love to attack herds of cattle. Feeding off their host's blood supply, ticks spend their lives on animals of all kinds, including cows. Ticks can even transmit potentially fatal diseases to cows through their bites.
The cattle tick is considered to be the most important parasite of livestock worldwide
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: The type of fruit that is formed from a single flower having several free carpels is?
explanation:
An aggregate fruit is a fruit that develops from the merger of several ovaries that were separated in a single flower.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: The part that performs urinogenital function in the male reproductive system is the?
explanation:
Urethra — this is a tube that extends from the bladder to the external opening at the end of the penis. The urethra carries both urine and sperm.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: The components of blood in man are?

options.A: red blood cells, white blood cells, plasma and water
options.B: red blood cells, white blood cells, and plasma
options.C: red blood cells, white blood cells, and platelets
options.D: red blood cells, white blood cells, plasma and platelets

explanation:
It has four main components: plasma, red blood cells, white blood cells, and platelets.
Blood has many different functions, including: transporting oxygen and nutrients to the lungs and tissues.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: The development of big muscles by a wrestler is an example of?
explanation:
Acquired traits include things such as calluses on fingers, larger muscle size from exercise or from avoiding predators.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: Lack of nucleus is a feature in?
explanation:
Red blood cells are microscopic and have the shape of a flat disk or doughnut, which is round with an indentation in the center, but it isn't hollow.
Red blood cells don't have a nucleus like white blood cells, allowing them to change shape and move throughout your body easier.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: A universal recipient of blood belongs to blood group?
explanation:
Blood donors with type O- (O negative) red blood cells are referred to as universal donors and their red blood cells can be given to any other blood type.
Type AB-positive blood is called the "universal recipient" type because a person who has it can receive blood of any type.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: The internal structure of a leaf that has larger air space is?
explanation:
The spongy mesophyll's function is to allow for the interchange of gases (CO 2) that are needed for photosynthesis.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: An example of arboreal animal is?
explanation:
Arboreal animals arethose animals that spend most of their life on trees. They feed, travel, play, and sleep on trees.
1.Koalas· 2. Black spider monkeys · 3. Siamang Gibbon · 4. Three-toed Sloth · 5. squirrel · 6. Rough green snake · 7. Veiled Chameleons · 8. Common brown lemurs.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: The movement of sugars from the leaf to other parts of plant is?
explanation:
Translocation is the movement of materials in plants from the leaves to other parts of the plant.
Nutrients, mainly sugars, are created in the leaves during photosynthesis. These are then transported throughout the plant through phloem, which are a long series of connected cells.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: Gaseous exchange in annelids is more advanced and efficient compared to flatworms because?

options.A: the cells of their epidermis have no blood capillaries
options.B: they have well developed respiratory structures
options.C: their cylindrical shape gives high surface area to volume ratio
options.D: their surface area to volume ratio is very low

explanation:
The correct answer is B. They have well-developed respiratory structures.
Annelids, such as earthworms, have a more advanced respiratory system compared to flatworms. They possess Setae (bristles) that increase the surface area for gas exchange, a well-developed circulatory system with blood capillaries that facilitate oxygen transport as well as a moist, thin cuticle that allows for gas diffusion.
These specialized respiratory structures enable annelids to exchange gases more efficiently than flatworms, which rely on simple diffusion across their body surface.

text: The structure that joins the two strands of a chromosome together is the?
explanation:
Centromeres are chromosomal regions that mediate kinetochore assembly and spindle attachment during cell division.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: When a colour blind woman marries a normal man, what is the probability of their son being colour blind?
explanation:
If a woman is colorblind, that means she has the nonworking gene on both X chromosomes.
Since sons almost always get their only X chromosome from their mom, chances are they will be colorblind too
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: The correct pathway for blood flow from the heart to the tissues of mammals is?
explanation:
Arteries carry blood away from the heart and veins carry blood back to the heart.
Arteries transport blood away from the heart and branch into smaller vessels, forming arterioles. Arterioles distribute blood to capillary beds, the sites of exchange with the body tissues. Capillaries lead back to small vessels known as venules that flow into the larger veins and eventually back to the heart.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: Tall trees with buttress roots and evergreen leaves are characteristics features of?
explanation:
Rainforest trees are quite different from trees of temperate forests. In the rainforest, trees grow to gigantic size, supported by strong, strut-like buttresses at the base of the trunk that help to stabilize them in shallow forest soils. Huge creepers twine themselves around the trunks of trees.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: The genes crossing over occurs during?
explanation:
Specifically, meiosis creates new combinations of genetic material in each of the four daughter cells.
These new combinations result from the exchange of DNA between paired chromosomes. Such exchange means that the gametes produced through meiosis exhibit an amazing range of genetic variation.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: In genetic counseling, a man with hemoglobin  formation HbA HbS is most preferred to marry a woman of?
explanation:
AS and AS should not marry, there is every chance of having a child with SS. AS and SS
AA marries an AS. You'll end up with kids with AA and AS which is good.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: An ecological instrument used to measure wind direction is?
explanation:
Wind direction is usually measured using a wind vane.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: The growth of mucor on a piece of bread is?
explanation:
Bread mold is saprophytic, as are most types of fungi.
An organism that is saprophytic is one that feeds off of dead or decaying.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: Conversion of atmosphere carbon into chemical bond energy occurs during the process of?
explanation:
As photosynthetic organisms, plants take up atmospheric CO2, chemically reducing the carbon.
This represents not only an acquisition of stored chemical energy for the plant, but also provides the carbon skeletons for the organic molecules that make up a plants' structure.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: The display of male agama lizard is to?
explanation:
Tail wagging, bright colors, mouth gaping/display, inflation, body posture, head bobs and 'push-ups' (some animals are capable of changing color to attract mates) are some displays that allow lizards to send signals to translate to a potential mate
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: The end product of the digestion of carbohydrate is?
explanation:
The final product of carbohydrate digestion is primarily glucose along with some fructose, glucose, and galactose, while amino acids are the end products of protein digestion
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: The sum total of all observable features of an organism is?
explanation:
Phenotype refers to an individual's observable traits, such as height, eye color and blood type.
A person's phenotype is determined by both their genomic makeup (genotype) and environmental factors.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: Pentadactyl plan of the fore limbs of frog, bird, horse, whale and man is a proof of?
explanation:
The limbs of crocodiles, birds, whales, horses, bats and humans all look very different they share the same five fingered bone structure.
This provides evidence for the theory of evolution .
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: The under secretion of thyroxine in children results in?
explanation:
Congenital hypothyroidism, previously known as cretinism, is a severe deficiency of thyroid hormone in newborns.
It causes impaired neurological function, stunted growth, and physical deformities
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: Petaloid sepals serve the function of?

options.B: attracting pollinating agents to a flower
options.C: retaining pollen grains in the corolla tubes
options.D: protecting the inner floral parts of the flower

explanation: Petaloid sepals, which are sepals that resemble and function like petals, primarily attract pollinators. These modified sepals are often colourful and take on the role of petals in attracting insects, birds, or other animals that facilitate pollination.

text: The system of classification in which there are seven hierarchies from kingdom to species was introduced by?
explanation:
Carolus Linnaeus is the father of taxonomy, which is the system of classifying and naming organisms.
One of his contributions was the development of a hierarchical system of classification of nature.
Today, this system includes eight taxa: domain, kingdom, phylum, class, order, family, genus, and species.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: An adaptive feature of camel to the desert is?

options.B: ability to pass high amount of urine
options.C: ability to tolerate low degree of dehydration
options.D: ability to tolerate high degree of dehydration

explanation:
The hump present in the camel helps them travel long periods without water to survive in the desert's harsh conditions.
Thus the hump acts as a fat reserve or an energy reserve.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: The part labelled II is?
explanation:
Similar cytoplasmic bridges link the cells of all volvocacean embryos.
I.e neighboring cells are often joined together by strands of cytoplasm.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: The organism above is?
explanation:
Volvox is a polyphyletic genus of chlorophyte green algae in the family Volvocaceae. It forms spherical colonies of up to 50,000 cells.
Its plant body is coenobium and consists of large number of biflagellate, pear-shaped cells.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: The beak structure of the organism is best adapted for?
explanation:
The beaks of nectar sucking birds are long slender and pointed.
This helps in sucking nectar and also feeding insects and food to the young ones.
Birds like Hummingbirds have this kind of beaks.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: One of the functions of water in seed germination is to?

options.B: make the soil wet and soft

explanation:
The water activates special proteins, called enzymes, that begin the process of seed growth.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.
